elements.2211.03025_0b2267c15c76fe3f56448144f4e89: Spoken language understanding (SLU) is a task aiming to extract high-level semantics from spoken utterances
elements.2211.03025_bb3fe0ef1ead58fb433a57b4d7467: Previous works have investigated the use of speech self-supervised models and textual pre-trained models, which have shown reasonable improvements to various SLU tasks
elements.2211.03025_66b4bf4f1f2ef3797f2e51f5cd18d: However, because of the mismatched modalities between speech signals and text tokens, previous methods usually need complex designs of the frameworks
elements.2211.03025_fd83a41f0483513ea59fddf3762f2: This work proposes a simple yet efficient unsupervised paradigm that connects speech and textual pre-trained models, resulting in an unsupervised speech-to-semantic pre-trained model for various tasks in SLU
elements.2211.03025_ae78df3eb42e51b7048ee4e0cf428: To be specific, we propose to use unsupervised automatic speech recognition (ASR) as a connector that bridges different modalities used in speech and textual pre-trained models
elements.2211.03025_51f83ff8da94894d5a52e5a151541: Our experiments show that unsupervised ASR itself can improve the representations from speech self-supervised models
elements.2211.03025_083724c3d1345c0586856578db3ab: More importantly, it is shown as an efficient connector between speech and textual pre-trained models, improving the performances of five different SLU tasks
elements.2211.03025_7758b999ea3565189455f529d5e45: Notably, on spoken question answering, we reach the state-of-the-art result over the challenging NMSQA benchmark.
elements.2211.03025_cdfa14b00deb1e3fbf8f42e1cfb6d: unsupervised ASR, self-supervised learning, spoken language understanding
elements.2211.03025_4d74542611769bd6f0bc9619fa7ce: Transfer learning has been known as one of the major methodologies in the deep learning era
elements.2211.03025_7db06adccab50d2d9fef2888c081f: It has demonstrated its success in speech and natural language
elements.2211.03025_67ba9e1b3b67ff094c5442ebdcad7: In transfer learning, self-supervised learning (SSL) has been a large branch of studies that focuses on leveraging large amounts of unlabelled data
elements.2211.03025_b126aa7a50ebe19e66d33e94ab2d5: According to previous literature, SSL can learn to extract contextual representations that greatly improve the performances of various downstream tasks
elements.2211.03025_36bc53ee58859ab40e4ba1fc9c47f: Many real-world tasks involve transforming one modality to another (e.g., image caption, speech recognition/understanding, songwriting, etc.)
elements.2211.03025_4bd7889d3fb9921878755ea7f8714: Usually, there is a need to understand both modalities in those tasks
elements.2211.03025_209684d705f4718324022e35d1b7b: Given the advances in pre-trained models, several previous works have shown significant improvements by simply applying the pre-trained models
elements.2211.03025_bea882746951b8b823700f58468dd: In their applications, pre-trained models over source modalities are easier to adopt.
elements.2211.03025_eeea279c53f15f885b45cd548c31e: Spoken language understanding (SLU) is an example of modalities' transfer, which aims to infer the semantic meaning from spoken utterances.
elements.2211.03025_f1b253b315fd75072f3220c2b8930: Conventional SLU methods usually adopt a pipeline that consists of an automatic speech recognition (ASR) module and a natural language understanding (NLU) module
elements.2211.03025_3278ae53b63f2538160c88f3356b2: However, in recent days, more researchers have started to focus on end-to-end modeling as it could avoid potential error propagation between the two modules
elements.2211.03025_a32b3b51ba2ecf1ada69790143464: Because end-to-end SLU involves both NLP and speech processing knowledge, previous studies also revealed that SSL in each modality could improve end-to-end SLU performances
elements.2211.03025_50315cbce8137261e37f44ac3a27c: Some works have investigated the joint pre-training with both speech and text modalities
elements.2211.03025_59fb84f021b0645c204a8113ae1a1: While for most other works, researchers adopted speech SSL as a feature extractor, shown to receive improvements in both performance and efficiency
elements.2211.03025_2d4cb2da16553cc035889a5859913: On the other hand, textual SSLs are difficult to integrate into end-to-end SLU because of the mismatched modalities
elements.2211.03025_06d9ef9e46ebb6ec14a4bfdfbc961: Therefore, existing works usually need specific designs to utilize those textual pre-trained models, such as deliberation modules
elements.2211.03025_8c646394c4addfac3b7698622c8dd: All approaches could get decent performances on some SLU downstream tasks
elements.2211.03025_b72350a1d64957d88ff5e944bc53e: However, most of them complicate the training/inference procedure and need further fine-tuning with supervision when applied to downstream tasks
elements.2211.03025_eea7da2d8bfa7985b255b0d9855aa: To achieve a simple way of connecting SSLs between two modalities for SLU, this paper proposes a novel usage of unsupervised ASR (UASR) to bridge SSLs between two modalities in a fully
elements.2211.03025_ce2533ade5cc97dcc765a113ae938: We start with a base framework that applies UASR to augment the speech SSL model by considering unpaired textual information
elements.2211.03025_465eab9b55099c06e55098ef683be: Following that, we introduce the method that uses UASR to bridge speech and textual pre-trained models.
elements.2211.03025_332e874cb2c5d1813da68301f442c: In this work, we focus on connecting wav2vec2
elements.2211.03025_78195af496c101e8ae672e98f1e33: and a phoneme variant of ByT5
elements.2211.03025_5300f8543d205fa32af100bdc290a: Our experiments validate the advantages of our proposed methods in various tasks and settings
elements.2211.03025_8c012419dbbed17f23d760adf36ce: Notably, we also reach the state-of-the-art performance on the challenging NMSQA benchmark on spoken question answering
elements.2211.03025_3cbad4d8989ae42c78fb1c2d52577: : The SSL task is to find better speech representation for downstream tasks
elements.2211.03025_d32d37913d080c820cc49bc5f36ab: Previous SSL-related works usually utilize a speech-only corpus

elements.2211.03025_c05090f0a8707f8582b0e854f072a: , the modalities mismatch issue blocks constructing pre-trained speech-to-semantic models in an unsupervised manner
elements.2211.03025_ebd5adeb2dc306dab15632b544cdf: Since UASR targets conducting recognition in an unsupervised fashion, it could naturally be a glue to connect the acoustic and textual pre-trained models
elements.2211.03025_d5bd9e710f8deeb124e502cc3de81: We argue that using UASR as a connector would have three more benefits, apart from the mitigation of the modalities mismatch issue.
elements.2211.03025_a8c34cffa0ed573d43de5c6d85834: , adding UASR as a connector can still maintain the unsupervised property of the whole model.
elements.2211.03025_c7fb5eb468af5eed821d084d9c9b0: , the UASR module can introduce implicit textual knowledge from the adversarial objective
elements.2211.03025_188352b463d4f7a5afa3ce7b2a444: On the other hand, when applying UASR as a connector, it can adopt explicit textual resources that hold semantic information from the pre-trained text model
elements.2211.03025_76c9602559465fb10e8ffbb598bd9: : As previous methods usually need fine-tuning to mitigate the modalities mismatch between speech and text modalities, using UASR as a connector can relax the requirement for fine-tuning since the output of UASR is a text (phoneme)-level distribution.

elements.2211.03025_af84a1e77c29797293ede9bf9eeaf: To fully investigate the proposed methods, we conduct experiments in two folds: the first freezes the parameters of the pre-trained model; the second fine-tunes the textual pre-trained model.
elements.2211.03025_6218d54009e3d39cc5f643e6c0487: : In the freeze setting, we follow the exact setting of SUPERB benchmark
elements.2211.03025_72f36ac0a79c56bde7f577638b15c: As discussed in the previous section, we primarily focus on understanding tasks, including intent classification (IC), emotion recognition (ER), and speech translation (ST)
elements.2211.03025_dedfaabb4af3ea29306614b1b603b: However, as UASR are designed for recognition tasks, we also conduct experiments in ASR and phone recognition (PR)
elements.2211.03025_8ec5e26b3a21b7b765ad095bdc121: Meanwhile, we carry out the speaker identification (SID) task to verify if the UASR and the pre-trained text model are effective for semantic-related tasks.
elements.2211.03025_c9fc211abade3c4a3b0a0ff559557: : In the fine-tuning setting, we only conduct experiments that fine-tunes the textual model to match the configuration in
elements.2211.03025_5b3085e6f5165f6e18fd0fe5d2dbf: and to avoid joint training of a large model
elements.2211.03025_8c897252df5626bda41a746b844e9: that can support stronger downstream models
elements.2211.03025_a0d6279bc973a925989993aad6923: We intentionally select some different datasets that are larger than the ones in the SUPERB benchmark, evaluating the proposed method apart from the potential over-fitting issue in low-resource scenarios
elements.2211.03025_39ec6aa0554a10e8cb05358ed6a5e: Similar to the freeze setting, we focus on understanding tasks, including IC, ER, ST, and slot-filling (SF)
elements.2211.03025_a09931985321aff7da3db2091aaad: for IC and ST, IEMOCAP for ER
elements.2211.03025_5750b6ade0af6eb323017c2279dec: In addition, We also tested on a publicly available spoken question answering (SQA) NMSQA dataset
elements.2211.03025_5140851000a25500a15df9c475e9d: Three test sets included are derived from SQuAD
elements.2211.03025_01edf4d371afbc4c9844b3dd18499: , whereas the latter two are reported together as out-of-domain (OOD) samples.

elements.2211.03025_ceaa47905061f4fc935944adf7be5: : For the freeze setting, we follow exact settings as the SUPERB public benchmark, which adopts simple downstream models (e.g., stacked linear or recurrent layers)
elements.2211.03025_7c113a786c424a332894c4dcee8a3: For the fine-tuning setting, we utilize ESPnet
elements.2211.03025_4c25e524368cf170f8e186db49edd: for the downstream models except for SQA
elements.2211.03025_3572cf68da300728b81668b0d535b: For IC, SF, and ER, we adopt a conformer-based encoder-decoder network with the hybrid connectionist temporal classification (CTC)/attention style of training
elements.2211.03025_dd4e7080cb6874d6ecbc33d7fa708: While for ST, we adopt a transformer-based encoder-decoder with auxiliary ASR loss computed from CTC
elements.2211.03025_a17607ec8e64ef3579f5f7c6acf7d: Detailed network settings follow the corresponding configuration.
elements.2211.03025_c6aa19525a1453fc7104cba718678: For classification tasks like IC and ER, we also include ASR transcriptions as a joint learning objective
elements.2211.03025_be16c83bf9c80b906bbc922f03123: For all models in ESPnet, we apply specaugment to the hidden states from pre-trained models
elements.2211.03025_e31e7718eddd1ccd489dd915988a9: For SQA, it is difficult to hold the whole speech SSL features for the spoken context of answers
elements.2211.03025_43f06d52bd845e4af5b92eb6b8816: Therefore, we employ a two-step approach
elements.2211.03025_02c301391bfa1277d05349f7c25cc: Specifically, questions and contexts are converted into time-coded phoneme sequences by UASR
elements.2211.03025_25bf66b584fd13c853fea7b7e9357: Given questions and contexts, the PT5 is fine-tuned to predict answer time spans in the context
elements.2211.03025_b9d47e954de1d1c8838ff9c95f997: The model is trained for 3 epochs with a 3e-4 learning rate and the best model is selected based on the performances on the development set.
elements.2211.03025_d9bdd8ec3b2a11e65e836c5435f2a: : For PR, we adopt phone error rate (PER), while for ASR, we utilize word error rate (WER)
elements.2211.03025_5dc25ff40fe4d108efc31c1c4f638: For IC and ER, we employ the accuracy rate
elements.2211.03025_c9740d3ffeef0b9935284711abf97: For slot-filling, we apply the slot-type F1 score
elements.2211.03025_dbfb2fca53573cf7efa0d48a66bc3: For ST, we use the BLEU score
elements.2211.03025_f41dac38d74d0d82bbade650db646: For SQA, we adopt the same evaluation metrics as
elements.2211.03025_9ad5f90b39cc648932e7a53df0d84: , including the area overlapping score (AOS) and frame F1 (FF1)
elements.2211.03025_ab761150d4033138082fedd51d37d: Note that when the answers cannot be extracted from the given context, we set AOS and FF1 to 0.

elements.2211.03025_a55d99f01fbfbc693349408bffb68: Though pre-trained models in speech and languages have shown to be effective, it is difficult to sequentially apply speech and language pre-trained models to scenarios of spoken language understanding
elements.2211.03025_4985e7eda458d73bfcc9093ce30b9: In this work, we propose using unsupervised mapping (i.e., UASR in our case) to mitigate the mismatch between modalities
elements.2211.03025_64fc8a984849ec3083bb792590980: We first show that adding UASR could enhance the original speech pre-trained model, then UASR is applied as a connector between speech and textual pre-trained models
elements.2211.03025_7b6e2086d1541a8113e72a0db4b0e: Extensive experiments, in various tasks and settings, demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method, which also shows possible solutions to other scenarios other than speech and language.
